medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient states her pain started 3 hours before arrival, described as twisting/cramping pain in the epigastrium predominantly, occurring intermittently, and is described as a mild diffuse pain. The discomfort lasts approximately 5 minutes and occurs every 20 minutes. No factors aggravate the symptoms; she denies alcohol use and has no history of high cholesterol. Nonbloody emesis occurred twice.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism; Abdominal pain in the past attributed to gastritis; cholecystectomy is the only abdominal surgery.
